meanings.def: to ask somebody for something especially in an anxious way because you want or need it very much
examples: Now you have to beg and plead.
beg for something He wants to see them beg for mercy.
beg somebody for something They begged him for help.
beg somebody Forgive me, I beg you!
beg something She begged permission to leave.
beg something of/from somebody I managed to beg a lift from a passing motorist.
Can I beg a favour of you?
beg (somebody) + speech ‘Give me one more chance,’ he begged (her).
beg somebody to do something She begged him not to go.
beg to do something He begged to be told the truth.
beg that… (formal) She begged that she be allowed to go.
(British English also) She begged that she should be allowed to go.
beg of somebody (formal) Don't leave me here, I beg of you!
beg somebody's something I have come to apologize and to beg your forgiveness.
We went to him to beg for forgiveness.
In the end they almost begged him to take the job.
We humbly beg Your Majesty to show mercy.

meanings.def: to ask somebody for money, food, etc., especially in the street
examples: London is full of homeless people begging in the streets.
a begging letter (= one that asks somebody for money)
a begging bowl (= used to beg for money with)
beg for something The children were begging for food.
beg for something from somebody They will have to beg for money from tourists.
beg something from somebody We managed to beg a meal from the cafe owner.
beg something They went off to beg food.

meanings.def: if a dog begs, it sits on its back legs with its front legs in the air, waiting to be given something
to ask somebody for permission to do something
examples: I beg leave to add a few comments of my own.

meanings.def: if something is going begging, it is available because nobody else wants it
examples: I’ll have that last cake if it’s going begging.

meanings.def: to ask somebody to forgive you for something you have said or done
examples: He returned to beg her pardon for his sudden outburst.

meanings.def: to make somebody want to ask a question that has not yet been answered
examples: All of which begs the question as to who will fund the project.

meanings.def: to talk about something as if it were definitely true, even though it might not be
examples: These assumptions beg the question that children learn languages more easily than adults.

meanings.def: used to tell somebody that you are sorry for something you have said or done
examples: I beg your pardon, I thought that was my coat.

meanings.def: used to ask somebody to repeat what they have just said because you did not hear
examples: ‘It's on Duke Street.’ ‘I beg your pardon.’ ‘Duke Street.’

meanings.def: used to tell somebody that you are offended by what they have just said or by the way that they have said it
examples: ‘Just go away.’ ‘I beg your pardon!’

meanings.def: used to say politely that you do not agree with something that has just been said
examples: ‘At least she is good at her job.’ ‘Oh, I beg to differ.’
